column5: hey  i have to go to a wedding in guelph for the weekend...  :wallbash:  is there anywhere to take a few casts from shore for anything... carp...bass....pike...  anything...   PLEASE  im gunna go crazy doing wedding crap all weekend
i see a river on the map im looking at...  is it the grand river?  and a lake...  guelph lake?
Well I hear about the Conestogo and Bellwood and Guelph lake also but I know nothing of the area. Someone will surely chime in with some help.
You can hit Fairy lake in Acton.Bass and whiskers,from when I can remember.
The speed river here in guelph has carp, bass and pike.  PM me if you want some spots to hit
Mike......put your rod down, and enjoy the wedding.Remember what happens to people who fish too much ?
No musky but let me know what you want to target and I'll PM you.
Guelph lake is supposed to have some decent pike fishing but I haven't fished it yet

Big Large Mouth in Guelph lake and more hammer handles then you can throw a rapala at...the speed and eromasa rivers both run through our little town and both hold bass and pike.  I'm home all weekend give a shout I'll put you on some spots!!

Yup, all bottled up in arberfolye, at 101 brock rd guelph.  Mike, pm me and I can send you to a nice hidding spot for fishing, and some nice scenery as well. Guelph lake is ok, it was much better years ago, fishing wise for me.

There is Rockwood Campgrounds 15 minutes east of Guelph. I camped with my wife 4 x's this summer. Beautiful place!!! Fishing isn't bad for smallies at the top of the(Eramosa) river, which the campground surrounds. They use to stock it with trout as well, but I have yet to catch one there. Here's a link below. Check it out!!!  http://www.grandrive...ks/rockwood.cfm

I am actually taking my brother out sunday morning to show him some spots around town but my guess is you'll probably be tired or hung-over to be up and out early on the sunday morning. Anyways you can pm as well if you need some help. Where's the wedding at?

lots of shore fishing - check  big carp - check  pike (big and small) - check  bass (smallies & largies) - check  perch - check  I fish there once or twice a year because its close to my folks place. Not a #s lake but you can catch the odd big bass or pike. Try to find some healthy weeds. Never caught a carp but seen lots of them. Theres always jumping and getting me to throw my lures hping its a bass feeding on surface.
Nice venue, well did you get any fishing in?
I didn't end up bringing my tackle... I decided 1 weekend without fishing would make the misses happy...  But I did hit up some local tackle shops for some new toys...
